articles.title: Greetings to President of Guyana
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guyana
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of greeting to David Arthur Granger, president of the Cooperative Republic of Guyana, on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of its proclamation.
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president good health and bigger success in his responsible work for progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Sultan of Brunei Darussalam
articles.content:
Greetings to Sultan of Brunei Darussalam
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of greeting to Haji Hassanal Bolkiah, sultan and head of state of Brunei Darussalam, on the occasion of its national holiday.
					 Expressing pleasure over the development of the friendly relations between the two countries on good terms, Kim Yong Nam in his message sincerely wished the sultan good health and happiness and the people of Brunei Darussalam well-being and prosperity.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Officials Visit Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Officials Visit Liberation Tower
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Russian embassy here laid a wreath at the Liberation Tower on Friday, on the occasion of the Day of Defenders of the Motherland.
					 Those present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Ambassador Alexandr Matsegora and Military Attache Alexei Bartusov.
					
					 A wreath was laid at the tower in the name of the Russian embassy.
					
					 The participants paid a silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the Soviet Army and looked round the tower.
					
					 The staff members of the Russian embassy also laid a wreath and flowers at the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in Sadong District of Pyongyang.
					
					 Earlier, they placed bouquets at liberation towers, statues of Soviet soldiers and monuments to the fallen Soviet soldiers in local areas.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Missions Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Delegations of political parties and organizations and personages of different countries paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK missions in their countries from Jan. 30 to Feb. 16 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and art pieces depicting the peerlessly great men and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They included delegations of the Workers' Party of Mexico, the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung and Leader Kim Jong Il, the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association, a delegation of several political parties of Nigeria, the deputy director of the Political Bureau of the Cuban Ministry of Revolutionary Armed Forces and his party, the general secretary of the C.C., Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), the chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association, the chairman of the Nepali Literary Forum for the Study of Songun Politics, the secretary general of the Bangladesh Jatiya Party, the president of the Bangladesh People's League, the general secretary of the C.C., Workers' Party of Bangladesh, the chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, the chairman of the Banglad
						esh Institute of the Juche Idea, the vice-general secretary of the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran and his party, the director of the International Department of the Iranian Workers' House and his party, the vice-chairman of the FUNCINPEC Party of Cambodia and his party, the director of the Central Secretariat of the Pakistan People's Party and his party, the secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation who is also the head of the  RussiaÔºçDPRK Friendship Parliamentary Group of the State Duma of Russia, the chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, the chief of the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK, personages of the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company of Russia, members of the Austrian preparatory committee for marking the Day of the Shining Star, the national chairman of the Federation of Students and Pupils of DR Congo and his party and members of the DR Congo preparatory committee for marking the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, the Veterans League of Laos, the Laos-Korea Friendship Association and the general secretary of the Guinean People's Assembly, the minister of Defence of Laos, the vice-prime minister and concurrently foreign minister of Laos, the president of the Lao Federation of Trade Unions of Laos and the president of the Central Committee of the Lao Women's Union sent floral baskets to the DPRK missions in their countries.

articles.title: GFTUK Delegation Leaves for Iran
articles.content:
GFTUK Delegation Leaves for Iran
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) led by Kim Tong Son, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, left here Friday to take part in the meeting of the Presidential Council of the World Federation of Trade Unions to be held in Iran.

articles.title: Sci-tech Achievements Made in Metallurgical Industry
articles.content:
Sci-tech Achievements Made in Metallurgical Industry
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The February 17 Shock Brigade of Scientists and Technicians is rendering great services to the building of an economic power as the core shock brigade and sci-tech advancing group of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The members of the February 17 Shock Brigade of Scientists and Technicians who were dispatched to the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex have recently made valuable sci-tech achievements conducive to putting the metallurgical industry on a Juche basis.
					
					 They established a new casting process for the oxygen heat blast furnace and developed a new binding material with domestic raw material.
					
					 They further increased the production capacity of oxygen, completed the combined automatic system for the oxygen heat blast furnace to suit the specific condition and settled sci-tech problems for raising the quality of steel.
					
					 They also manufactured and installed measuring devices needed in normal operation of waste-heat boiler, turbine generator and air compressor.
					
					 Meanwhile, they introduced a technology of producing the material for oxygen blowing and opened a prospect for making various valves by their own efforts.
					
					 Now they are putting spurs to the research into expanding the capacity of iron production and improving the quality of metallic material.

articles.title: Sci-tech Festival of Kim Chaek University of Technology Held
articles.content:
Sci-tech Festival of Kim Chaek University of Technology Held
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The 33rd Festival of Science and Technology of Kim Chaek University of Technology took place on Feb. 20-23.
					 The festival was held in the form of presentation and exhibition, divided into nine panels including machine industry, IT, metal and mining, energy and basic science. It was attended by teachers, researchers, postgraduates and students at the university.
					
					 Presented to the festival were more than 200 scientific research achievements and hi-tech products conductive to the integration of science and technology and economy.

articles.title: Sojourn in Pyongyang of Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Sojourn in Pyongyang of Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, visited the Sci-Tech Complex. The group is led by Chairman of the Nishi Tokyo Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan Ko Tok U.
					 The visitors went round different parts of the complex that was wonderfully built as a model of the Juche-based architecture and a modern base for disseminating science and technology.
					
					 The group also toured the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site, Pyongyang Primary School for Orphans and Pyongyang Middle School for Orphans, the Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory, etc.

articles.title: Seminar of Korean Social Scientists in Japan
articles.content:
Seminar of Korean Social Scientists in Japan
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A seminar of Korean social scientists in Japan was held at the Central Hall of Chongryon (the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan) in Tokyo on Feb. 17 to celebrate the 76th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Attending it were Kim Song Hun, director of the Department for Publicity and Culture of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, Chairman Ri Yong Su and members of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan and other officials of Chongryon.
					
					 Ri Yong Su said in a report that Kim Jong Il devoted his whole life to providing the strongest national defense capabilities to reliably defend the nation's dignity and the country's sovereignty and performed undying feats.
					
					 He praised respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un for translating into brilliant reality Kim Jong Il's patriotic wish for a powerful nation.
					
					 He noted that the New Year Address of Kim Jong Un is a highly important document as it carries his far-reaching plan and resolution and fighting strategy to usher in a new era of the country's prosperity by taking the historic victory in the building of the DPRK's nuclear force as a springboard for fresh progress.
					
					 Speakers at the seminar gave detailed explanations of the present context and the future of the standoff between the DPRK, which towered as a strategic state with dignity, and the U.S. and the struggle of all compatriots for making a breakthrough for independent reunification.

articles.title: Taekwon-Do Aces Loved by People
articles.content:
Taekwon-Do Aces Loved by People
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Among sportspersons loved by the DPRK people are Sin Jong Hwa and Kim Su Ryon, players of the Taekwon-Do team of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee.
					 They became the first quadruple world championship holders in the country after taking the first places at the women's individual 69kg and 75kg sparring matches of the 20th Taekwon-Do World Championships held last year.
					
					 Sin held the championship at the 15th, 18th and 19th Taekwon-Do world championships and Kim at the 17th, 18th and 19th Taekwon-Do world championships.
					
					 Sin bagged gold medals at the 7th World Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championship and the 4th, 5th and 7th Asian Taekwon-Do championships, while Kim at the 9th World Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championship and the 7th and 8th Asian Taekwon-Do championships.
					
					 They were awarded the title of People's Athlete.

articles.title: Nuclear Force of DPRK Is Powerful Weapon for Defending Peace: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Nuclear Force of DPRK Is Powerful Weapon for Defending Peace: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The nuclear force of the DPRK is the powerful treasured sword for defending peace as it can decisively tackle the nuclear threats and blackmail from the U.S., Rodong Sinmun Friday says in an article.
					 Noting that it is entirely just for the DPRK to bolster up its strength, the article goes on:
					
					 Concession to the imperialists and asking them for aid is a foolish act of inviting self-destruction as their nature is aggression and plunder. Every country can guarantee genuine peace and security only when its military strength is strong enough to smash any move of aggressors and provokers. Our army is putting spurs to deploying nuclear warheads and ballistic rockets whose power and reliability have already been proved. 
					
					 The U.S. and its vassal forces brand the nuclear force of the DPRK as "threat to world peace and security". This is nothing but a miserable scream made by those, who have a premonition of their destruction. It goes to prove that our nuclear force becomes the means meting out a horrible punishment to the aggressors.
					
					 Neither sanctions nor provocations nor threats can ever undermine our position of nuclear weapons state. Hoping that the DPRK would abandon its nuclear programs is as foolish an act as trying to wish seas to get dried up. It would be a wise option to take the stand to peacefully co-exist with the DPRK which has towered as a strategic state.

articles.title: Brief Biographies of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Introduced in Romania
articles.content:
Brief Biographies of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Introduced in Romania
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The Romanian National Committee for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star (birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il) posted the brief biographies of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on the website Juche Idea on Feb. 5 on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star and the Day of Army Founding.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Marked in DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Marked in DR Congo
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee of DR Congo for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il issued a bulletin on Feb. 1.
					 The bulletin carried an article titled "Birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il" and articles under the subtitles of "Mysterious wonders of nature," etc. 
					
					 It elaborated on the mysterious natural phenomena that presented themselves on Mt Paektu at the time that Kim Jong Il was born. It went on:
					
					 Though the Koreans suffered under the Japanese imperialist military occupation of Korea, they regarded as a beacon of hope Mt Paektu where General Kim Il Sung was conducting brisk activities while leading the anti-Japanese armed units. So, the news of the birth of the Shining Star of Mt Paektu Kim Jong Il, who would carry forward the cause of Kim Il Sung, was the greatest event for the Korean people.
					
					 Anti-Japanese fighters couldn't suppress the impulse to make the happy news known to all Koreans and so they carved words on barked trees in the forest.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il carried forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung without an inch of deflection true to the wishes and expectations of anti-Japanese fighters and the people. He enjoyed boundless reverence from the world progressives as a peerlessly great man as he glorified socialist Korea and dynamically advanced the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works Released in Belarus
articles.content:
Collection of Kim Jong Il's Works Released in Belarus
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) --"On Patriotism", a collection of leader Kim Jong Il's works, was released in Vitebsk City, Belarus on Feb. 5.
					 Attending the book-releasing ceremony were the editor-in-chief of the Belarusian magazine Social Education and other personages and citizens.
					
					 Editor-in-Chief Sergei Zebyatikh said that Kim Jong Il in his works clarified profound issues arising in the formation of a nation and the preservation of the national character.
					
					 He noted that Kim Jong Il's works elucidate the idea that patriotism must be expressed in concrete deeds, not in words, and through the practical service to the people.
					
					 Today the works of the great man make us think once again about the destiny of the country and nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Russia
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The full text of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was posted on the Russian website Irkutskblogspot. Ru on Feb. 6 ahead of the 70th founding anniversary of the Korean People's Army.
					 The work, published on April 15, Juche 101 (2012), clarifies that the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation is a history which clearly proved the immovable truth that each country and nation can defend their dignity and guarantee their prosperity only when they have an outstanding leader.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for glorifying the dignity of the DPRK for all ages and successfully accomplishing the cause of building a powerful socialist country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita dia de promulgacion de Guyana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita dia de promulgacion de Guyana
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio hoy un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Cooperativa de Guyana, David Arthur Granger, en ocasion del 48o aniversario de la promulgacion de ese pais.
					Convencido de que se intensificaran y se desarrollaran aun mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Guyana, el remitente formulo sinceros votos por la buena salud del destinatario y mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades para el progreso y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita el Dia Nacional de Brunei Darussalam
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita el Dia Nacional de Brunei Darussalam
 Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 23 un mensaje de felicitacion al sultan y jefe del Estado de Brunei Darussalam, Haji Hassanal Bolkiah, con motivo del Dia Nacional de este pais.
					Satisfecho de que se desarrollen positivamente las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises, el remitente desea al destinatario la buena salud y felicidad y a su pueblo el bienestar y prosperidad.

articles.title: Miembros de embajada rusa rinden tributo a martires del ejercito sovietico
articles.content:
Miembros de embajada rusa rinden tributo a martires del ejercito sovietico
 Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia de Defensores de la Patria, los miembros de la embajada rusa en Corea depositaron el dia 23 una ofrenda floral ante el Monumento a la Liberacion. 
					En la ceremonia de homenaje participaron el embajador Alexandr Matsegora, el agregado militar Alexei Bartusov y otros integrantes de la sede diplomatica rusa.
					
					Fue colocada ante el monumento una ofrenda floral en nombre de la embajada. 
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires del ejercito sovietico y dieron vuelta por el lugar.
					
					Igualmente, ellos colocaron una ofrenda y ramos de flores ante la tumba de los martires del ejercito sovietico, situada en el capitalino municipio de Sadong.
					
					Con anterioridad, depositaron los ramos de flores al pie de los monumentos a la liberacion, las estatuas de bronce de los militares del ejercito sovietico y los monumentos en memoria de los mismos, levantados en diferentes localidades de Corea.

articles.title: Efectuado 33o festival de ciencia y tecnica de la Universidad Tecnica Kim Chaek
articles.content:
Efectuado 33o festival de ciencia y tecnica de la Universidad Tecnica Kim Chaek
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar desde el dia 20 hasta el 23 el 33o festival de ciencia y tecnica de la Universidad Tecnica Kim Chaek con la participacion de los profesores, investigadores, cursantes del instituto doctoral y estudiantes del plantel docente.
					El festival se realizo dividido en 9 secciones, inclusive la industria mecanica, IT, metalurgia y extraccion, energia y ciencia basica, y a manera de presentacion y exhibicion de exitos cientifico-tecnicos.
					
					Se exhibieron en la ocasion mas de 200 resultados de investigacion cientifica y productos tecnicos sofisticados que ayudaron mucho a la unificacion de ciencia y tecnica con la economia. 
					
					El lugar especial lo ocupo la Facultad de Ingenieria de Materiales y el primer puesto correspondio a mas de 10 iniciativas, presentadas por los profesores e investigadores del Instituto Superior de Ciencia y Tecnica Mecanicas, el Instituto Superior de Ciencia y Tecnica Informaticas y las facultades de metalurgia, fisica y mineria, etc.

articles.title: Armas nucleares de RPDC defienden la paz de region, destaca Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Armas nucleares de RPDC defienden la paz de region, destaca Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- Las fuerzas armadas nucleares de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea defenderan confiablemente la paz de la region haciendo rotundo frente a cualquier amenaza y chantaje nucleares de Estados Unidos.
					Asi subraya el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual divulgado el dia 23 y continua:
					
					Es mil veces justo el que la RPDC fortalece mas su fuerza.
					
					Conceder y mendigar a los imperialistas cuya naturaleza es la agresion y el saqueo, resultan la autodestruccion.
					
					La paz y seguridad verdaderas se garantizan por la poderosa fuerza militar capaz de aniquilar a los agresores.
					
					El Ejercito Popular de Corea da acicate a la ubicacion en las unidades de combate real de las ojivas nucleares y los cohetes balisticos, cuya potencialidad y confianza ya fueron comprobadas.
					
					EE.UU. y sus seguidores acusan nuestras armas nucleares de la "amenaza a la paz y la seguridad del mundo", lo cual no pasa de ser una queja de quienes estan a punto de arruinarse y comprueba el hecho de que las armas nucleares de nuestro Estado devienen el castigo severo para los agresores.
					
					Cualesquier sancion, provocacion y amenaza no podran eliminar jamas la posicion de la RPDC, pais poseedor de armas nucleares.
					
					Esperar la renuncia nuclear de la RPDC es una idea estupida.
					
					Sera una opcion clarividente tomar la posicion de coexistir con la RPDC, bruscamente emergida como Estado estrategico.
